intro: Echinocereus triglochidiatus var. melanacanthus, commonly known as the black spined hedgehog cactus, is a member of the Cactaceae family native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, columnar cactus with dark green, ribbed stems that bear clusters of bright yellow flowers during the summer months. The plant is characterized by its dense, black spines that provide protection from herbivores and intense sunlight. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
